msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 403 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 8; Complete text of the Qur'an; 16 lines per page; Dimensions: 220 x 155 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 16: "44 E. H. 8 Aynı Parşömen. 155mm boy ve 220mm eninde 403 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yazı ile 160mm uzunl.[uğunda] 16 satır. Tahmine göre III-IV. (IX-X) asırda kopya edilmiştir. Harekeler kırmızı noktalar, noktalar da siyahla yazılır. Sure başları yaldızladır. Miklepli ve şemseli kırmızı deri Osmanlı cildi."

This can be translated as follows: "44 E. H. 8 Same Parchment. 403 leaves of 155 mm height and 220 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 16 lines measuring 160 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd-4th (9th-10th) centuries. Vowel marks are as red dots, and the dots are black. Gilded sūra beginnings. Red leather Ottoman binding with flap (miklep) and mandorla (şemse)."
